title: Authors and Citation
text: Fischer S, Schulz-Kümpel H (2025). mlr3inferr: Inference Generalization Error. R package version 0.1.0-9000, https://github.com/mlr-org/mlr3inferr, https://mlr3inferr.mlr-org.com.
code: @Manual{,   title = {mlr3inferr: Inference on the Generalization Error},   author = {Sebastian Fischer and Hannah Schulz-Kümpel},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0-9000,     https://github.com/mlr-org/mlr3inferr},   url = {https://mlr3inferr.mlr-org.com}, }

title: Inference on the Generalization Error
text: Methods statistical inference generalization error. Package website

title: Inference on the Generalization Error
text: main purpose package allow obtain confidence intervals generalization error number resampling methods. , evaluate decision tree sonar task using holdout resampling obtain confidence interval generalization error. achieved using msr("ci.holdout") measure, pass another mlr3::Measure determines loss function. also possible select default inference method certain Resampling method using msr("ci") mlr3viz, also possible visualize multiple confidence intervals. , compare random forest decision tree featureless learner:  Note : methods require pointwise loss functions, .e. $obs_loss field. every resampling method exists inference method. combinations datasets learners, inference methods can fail.
code: library(mlr3inferr)  rr = resample(tsk("sonar"), lrn("classif.rpart"), rsmp("holdout")) # 0.05 is also the default ci = msr("ci.holdout", "classif.acc", alpha = 0.05) rr$aggregate(ci) #>       classif.acc classif.acc.lower classif.acc.upper  #>         0.7391304         0.6347628         0.8434981 ci_default = msr("ci", "classif.acc") rr$aggregate(ci_default) #>       classif.acc classif.acc.lower classif.acc.upper  #>         0.7391304         0.6347628         0.8434981 library(mlr3learners) library(mlr3viz)  bmr = benchmark(benchmark_grid(   tsks(c("sonar", "german_credit")),   lrns(c("classif.rpart", "classif.ranger", "classif.featureless")),   rsmp("subsampling") ))  autoplot(bmr, "ci", msr("ci", "classif.ce"))

title: Inference on the Generalization Error
text: mlr3inferr free open source software project encourages participation feedback. issues, questions, suggestions feedback, please hesitate open “issue” GitHub page! case problems / bugs, often helpful provide “minimum working example” showcases behaviour (don’t worry bug obvious). Please understand resources project limited: response may sometimes delayed days, feature suggestions may rejected deemed tangential vision behind project.

what: Abstract Class for Confidence Intervals — mlr_measures_abstract_ci
title: Abstract Class for Confidence Intervals — mlr_measures_abstract_ci
text: Base class confidence interval measures. See section Inheriting add new method.

title: Abstract Class for Confidence Intervals — mlr_measures_abstract_ci
text: aggregator wrapped measure ignored, inheriting CI dictates point estimate constructed. measure calculate CI $obs_loss also $trafo, (RMSE), delta method used obtain confidence intervals.

title: Abstract Class for Confidence Intervals — mlr_measures_abstract_ci
text: alpha :: numeric(1) desired alpha level. initialized $0.05$. within_range :: logical(1) Whether  restrict confidence interval within range possible values. initialized TRUE.

title: Abstract Class for Confidence Intervals — mlr_measures_abstract_ci
text: define new CI method, inherit abstract base class implement private method: ci: function(tbl: data.table, rr: ResampleResult, param_vals: named list()) -> numeric(3) requires_obs_loss set TRUE, tbl contains columns loss, row_id iteration, pointwise loss, Otherwise, tbl contains result rr$score() name loss column set "loss". identifier observation resampling iteration. return vector containing estimate, lower upper boundary order. case confidence interval form (estimate, estimate - z * se, estimate + z * se) also necessary implement private method: .trafo: function(ci: numeric(3), measure: Measure) -> numeric(3) receives confidence interval pointwise loss (e.g. squared-error) transforms according transformation measure$trafo (e.g. sqrt go mse rmse).

title: Abstract Class for Confidence Intervals — mlr_measures_abstract_ci
Abstract Class for Confidence Intervals — mlr_measures_abstract_ci
text: resamplings (character()) resampling classes method can operate. measure (Measure)

title: Abstract Class for Confidence Intervals — mlr_measures_abstract_ci
Abstract Class for Confidence Intervals — mlr_measures_abstract_ci
Abstract Class for Confidence Intervals — mlr_measures_abstract_ci
Abstract Class for Confidence Intervals — mlr_measures_abstract_ci
code: MeasureAbstractCi$new(   measure = NULL,   param_set = ps(),   packages = character(),   resamplings,   label,   delta_method = FALSE,   requires_obs_loss = TRUE )

title: Abstract Class for Confidence Intervals — mlr_measures_abstract_ci
text: measure (Measure) measure calculate confidence interval. Must $obs_loss. param_set (ParamSet) Set hyperparameters. packages (character()) Set required packages. warning signaled constructor least one packages installed, loaded (attached) later -demand via requireNamespace(). resamplings (character()) resampling classes measure can applied. label (character(1)) Label new instance. delta_method (logical(1)) Whether use delta method measures (RMSE) trafo. requires_obs_loss (logical(1)) Whether inference method requires pointwise loss function.

title: Abstract Class for Confidence Intervals — mlr_measures_abstract_ci
text: Obtain point estimate, well lower upper CI boundary.

Default CI Method — mlr_measures_ci
text: certain resampling methods, default confidence interval methods. See mlr3::mlr_reflections$default_ci_methods selection. measure select appropriate CI method depending class used Resampling.

title: Default CI Method — mlr_measures_ci
text: Obtain point estimate, well lower upper CI boundary.

title: Default CI Method — mlr_measures_ci
code: rr = resample(tsk("sonar"), lrn("classif.featureless"), rsmp("holdout")) rr$aggregate(msr("ci", "classif.acc")) #>       classif.acc classif.acc.lower classif.acc.upper  #>         0.3913043         0.2753062         0.5073025  # is the same as: rr$aggregate(msr("ci.holdout", "classif.acc")) #>       classif.acc classif.acc.lower classif.acc.upper  #>         0.3913043         0.2753062         0.5073025

title: Conservative-Z CI — mlr_measures_ci_con_z
text: conservative-z confidence intervals based ResamplingPairedSubsampling. variance estimate obtained using n / 2 observations, tends conservative. inference method can also applied non-decomposable losses.

title: Conservative-Z CI — mlr_measures_ci_con_z
text: Nadeau, Claude, Bengio, Yoshua (1999). “Inference generalization error.” Advances neural information processing systems, 12.

title: Conservative-Z CI — mlr_measures_ci_con_z
code: ci_conz = msr("ci.con_z", "classif.acc") ci_conz #> <MeasureCiConZ:classif.acc>: Conservative-Z CI #> * Packages: mlr3, mlr3measures, mlr3inferr #> * Range: [0, 1] #> * Minimize: FALSE #> * Average: custom #> * Parameters: alpha=0.05, within_range=TRUE #> * Properties: primary_iters #> * Predict type: response

title: Corrected-T CI — mlr_measures_ci_cor_t
text: Corrected-T confidence intervals based ResamplingSubsampling. heuristic factor applied correct dependence iterations. confidence intervals tend liberal. inference method can also applied non-decomposable losses.

title: Corrected-T CI — mlr_measures_ci_cor_t
text: Nadeau, Claude, Bengio, Yoshua (1999). “Inference generalization error.” Advances neural information processing systems, 12.

title: Corrected-T CI — mlr_measures_ci_cor_t
code: m_cort = msr("ci.cor_t", "classif.acc") m_cort #> <MeasureCiCorrectedT:classif.acc>: Corrected-T CI #> * Packages: mlr3, mlr3measures, mlr3inferr #> * Range: [0, 1] #> * Minimize: FALSE #> * Average: custom #> * Parameters: alpha=0.05, within_range=TRUE #> * Properties: primary_iters #> * Predict type: response rr = resample(   tsk("sonar"),   lrn("classif.featureless"),   rsmp("subsampling", repeats = 10) ) rr$aggregate(m_cort) #>       classif.acc classif.acc.lower classif.acc.upper  #>         0.4898551         0.3408775         0.6388327

title: Holdout CI — mlr_measures_ci_holdout
text: Standard holdout CI. inference method can applied decomposable losses.

title: Holdout CI — mlr_measures_ci_holdout
code: ci_ho = msr("ci.holdout", "classif.acc") ci_ho #> <MeasureCiHoldout:classif.acc>: Holdout CI #> * Packages: mlr3, mlr3measures, mlr3inferr #> * Range: [0, 1] #> * Minimize: FALSE #> * Average: custom #> * Parameters: alpha=0.05, within_range=TRUE #> * Properties: primary_iters #> * Predict type: response rr = resample(tsk("sonar"), lrn("classif.featureless"), rsmp("holdout")) rr$aggregate(ci_ho) #>       classif.acc classif.acc.lower classif.acc.upper  #>         0.5507246         0.4324975         0.6689518

title: Nested CV CI — mlr_measures_ci_ncv
text: Confidence Intervals based ResamplingNestedCV, including bias-correction. inference method can applied decomposable losses.

title: Nested CV CI — mlr_measures_ci_ncv
text: MeasureAbstractCi, well : bias :: logical(1) Whether bias correction. initialized TRUE. FALSE, outer iterations used point estimate bias correction applied.

title: Nested CV CI — mlr_measures_ci_ncv
text: Bates, Stephen, Hastie, Trevor, Tibshirani, Robert (2024). “Cross-validation: estimate well ?” Journal American Statistical Association, 119(546), 1434–1445.

title: Nested CV CI — mlr_measures_ci_ncv
code: ci_ncv = msr("ci.ncv", "classif.acc") ci_ncv #> <MeasureCiNestedCV:classif.acc>: Nested CV CI #> * Packages: mlr3, mlr3measures, mlr3inferr #> * Range: [0, 1] #> * Minimize: FALSE #> * Average: custom #> * Parameters: bias=TRUE, alpha=0.05, within_range=TRUE #> * Properties: primary_iters #> * Predict type: response

title: Cross-Validation CI — mlr_measures_ci_wald_cv
text: Confidence intervals cross-validation. method asymptotically exact called Test Error defined Bayle et al. (2020). (expected) risk, confidence intervals tend liberal. inference method can applied decomposable losses.

title: Cross-Validation CI — mlr_measures_ci_wald_cv
text: MeasureAbstractCi, well : variance :: "-pairs" "within-fold" estimate variance. results tend similar.

title: Cross-Validation CI — mlr_measures_ci_wald_cv
text: Bayle, Pierre, Bayle, Alexandre, Janson, Lucas, Mackey, Lester (2020). “Cross-validation confidence intervals test error.” Advances Neural Information Processing Systems, 33, 16339–16350.

title: Cross-Validation CI — mlr_measures_ci_wald_cv
code: m_waldcv = msr("ci.wald_cv", "classif.ce") m_waldcv #> <MeasureCiWaldCV:classif.ce>: Naive CV CI #> * Packages: mlr3, mlr3measures, mlr3inferr #> * Range: [0, 1] #> * Minimize: TRUE #> * Average: custom #> * Parameters: variance=all-pairs, alpha=0.05, within_range=TRUE #> * Properties: primary_iters #> * Predict type: response rr = resample(tsk("sonar"), lrn("classif.featureless"), rsmp("cv")) rr$aggregate(m_waldcv) #>       classif.ce classif.ce.lower classif.ce.upper  #>        0.4663462        0.3985507        0.5341416

title: Nested Cross-Validation — mlr_resamplings_ncv
text: implements Nested CV resampling procedure Bates et al. (2024).

title: Nested Cross-Validation — mlr_resamplings_ncv
text: folds :: integer(1) number folds. initialized 5. repeats :: integer(1) number repetitions. initialized 10.

title: Nested Cross-Validation — mlr_resamplings_ncv
text: Bates, Stephen, Hastie, Trevor, Tibshirani, Robert (2024). “Cross-validation: estimate well ?” Journal American Statistical Association, 119(546), 1434–1445.

title: Nested Cross-Validation — mlr_resamplings_ncv
text: mlr3::Resampling$format() mlr3::Resampling$help() mlr3::Resampling$instantiate() mlr3::Resampling$print() mlr3::Resampling$test_set() mlr3::Resampling$train_set()

title: Nested Cross-Validation — mlr_resamplings_ncv
text: Convert resampling iteration useful representation. outer resampling iterations, inner NA.

title: Nested Cross-Validation — mlr_resamplings_ncv
code: ncv = rsmp("nested_cv", folds = 3, repeats = 10L) ncv #> <ResamplingNestedCV>: Nested CV #> * Iterations: 90 #> * Instantiated: FALSE #> * Parameters: folds=3, repeats=10 rr = resample(tsk("mtcars"), lrn("regr.featureless"), ncv)

title: Paired Subsampling — mlr_resamplings_paired_subsampling
text: Paired Subsampling enable inference generalization error. One directlu call $aggregate() non-CI measure resample result using paired subsampling, resampling iterations intended

title: Paired Subsampling — mlr_resamplings_paired_subsampling
text: first repeats_in iterations standard ResamplingSubsampling used obtain point estimate generalization error. remaining iterations used estimate standard error. , data divided repeats_out times two equally sized disjunct subsets, subsampling , subsampling repeats_in repetitions applied. See $unflatten(iter) method map iterations nested structure.

title: Paired Subsampling — mlr_resamplings_paired_subsampling
text: repeats_in :: integer(1) inner repetitions. repeats_out :: integer(1) outer repetitions. ratio :: numeric(1) proportion data use training.

title: Paired Subsampling — mlr_resamplings_paired_subsampling
text: Nadeau, Claude, Bengio, Yoshua (1999). “Inference generalization error.” Advances neural information processing systems, 12.

title: Paired Subsampling — mlr_resamplings_paired_subsampling
text: mlr3::Resampling$format() mlr3::Resampling$help() mlr3::Resampling$instantiate() mlr3::Resampling$print() mlr3::Resampling$test_set() mlr3::Resampling$train_set()

title: Paired Subsampling — mlr_resamplings_paired_subsampling
text: Unflatten resampling iteration informative representation: inner: subsampling iteration outer: NA first repeats_in iterations. Otherwise indicates outer iteration paired subsamplings. partition: NA first repeats_in iterations. Otherwise indicates whether subsampling applied first second partition two disjoint halfs.

title: Paired Subsampling — mlr_resamplings_paired_subsampling
code: pw_subs = rsmp("paired_subsampling") pw_subs #> <ResamplingPairedSubsampling>: Paired Subsampling #> * Iterations: 315 #> * Instantiated: FALSE #> * Parameters: repeats_in=15, repeats_out=10, ratio=0.9
